DataElement.preferredName: Ex Vivo Manipulation Without Erythrocyte Remove Or Volume Reduced Graft Method Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the method of ex vivo graft manipulation other than for RBC removal or volume reduction.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Ex Vivo Manipulation Without Erythrocyte Remove Or Volume Reduced Graft Method
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Outside the living body; referring to the use or positioning of an organ, tissue, or cell in an environment outside the living organism while the tissue or cells remain viable._Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner._Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone._Cell specialized for oxygen transport, having a high concentration of hemoglobin in the cytoplasm and little else; biconcave, anucleate discs, 7nm diameter in mammals._Shift the position or location of; take out of._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container._Made less in size or amount or degree._Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ObjectClass.preferredName: ex vivo Manipulation Without Erythrocyte Remove Or Volume Reduced Transplant
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Outside the living body; referring to the use or positioning of an organ, tissue, or cell in an environment outside the living organism while the tissue or cells remain viable.:Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner.:Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone. (from Merriam-Webster OnLine):Red blood cells. Mature erythrocytes are non-nucleated, biconcave disks containing hemoglobin whose function is to transport oxygen.:No Value Exists:Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Volume; the amount of 3-dimensional space occupied by an object.:Reduced; made less in size or amount or degree.:Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.

Concepts.definition: Outside the living body; referring to the use or positioning of an organ, tissue, or cell in an environment outside the living organism while the tissue or cells remain viable.
Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner.
Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.
A blood cell specialized for oxygen transport, having a high concentration of hemoglobin in the cytoplasm. They are biconcave, anucleate discs, with a 6-8um diameter in humans.
Shift the position or location of; take out of.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.
Made less in size or amount or degree.
Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.

Property.preferredDefinition: A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

Concepts.definition: A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Hematopoietic Stem Cell Graft Manipulation Method Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body._Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: CD34 is a protein found on the surface of some bone marrow and blood cells.  CD34 selection is a process where the protein is identified as the tissue is run through a machine and the positive cells are selected out from the non-CD34+ cells.

Concepts.definition: CD34 is a protein found on the surface of some bone marrow and blood cells.  CD34 selection is a process where the protein is identified as the tissue is run through a machine and the positive cells are selected out from the non-CD34+ cells.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.: Outside the living body; referring to the use or positioning of an organ, tissue, or cell in an environment outside the living organism while the tissue or cells remain viable.: Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Outside the living body; referring to the use or positioning of an organ, tissue, or cell in an environment outside the living organism while the tissue or cells remain viable.
Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Outside the living body; referring to the use or positioning of an organ, tissue, or cell in an environment outside the living organism while the tissue or cells remain viable.: Increase; a process of becoming larger or more numerous or more important.

Concepts.definition: Outside the living body; referring to the use or positioning of an organ, tissue, or cell in an environment outside the living organism while the tissue or cells remain viable.
A process of becoming larger, more numerous, more important, or more likely.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.: The separation of specific cells or cell populations in a hematopoietic cell product.  Specifically it pertains to the removal of a population of undesired cells through recognition and elimination of cells bearing the specified characteristics. Methods may include physical, immunologic or pharmacologic techniques.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
The selective removal of undesired cells through recognition and elimination of cells bearing specified characteristics, leaving the target cells more highly represented in the remaining mixture.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Removal of tumor cells from the graft.

Concepts.definition: Removal of tumor cells from the graft.

Treatment to destroy T cells, which play an important role in the immune response. Elimination of T cells from a bone marrow graft or peripheral blood stem cell graft from a donor may reduce the chance of an immune reaction against the recipient's tissues.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
